title: CanvasGroupy
text: This module will use GroupEng to create canvas and github groups.

title: CanvasGroupy
text:
How to use
Please visit GroupEng Official Website to see the documnetation of how to use GroupEng.

assign_groups("example/sample_group_specification.groupeng")

title: GroupEngAssign
text:
source

assign_groups

 assign_groups (groupeng_config:str)










Type
Details




groupeng_config
str
Directory for the GroupEng config yml file


Returns
(<class ‘bool’>, <class ‘str’>)
Status and output directory of the compile file.




print(os.listdir("example")) # take a look at the example files name

['sample_group_specification.groupeng', '.DS_Store', 'sample_group_specification_annotated.groupeng', 'sample_class_1.csv', '.ipynb_checkpoints']



status, outdir = assign_groups("example/sample_group_specification.groupeng")


# take a look at the output
status, outdir

(False, 'groups_example_2023-04-14_17-36-01')


The false means that at least one requirment is not satisfied. We can take a look at the file that was generated.

details = pd.read_csv(os.path.join(outdir, "example_details.csv"), on_bad_lines='skip')

title: GitHub Group Creation
text:
source

command

 command (cmd:str)

Execute the given command in shell









Type
Details




cmd
str
command to call in bash


Returns
(<class ‘bool’>, <class ‘str’>)
success, output




source


check_gh_auth

 check_gh_auth ()

Check whether you have gh auth configured

source


creat_repo_cmd

 creat_repo_cmd (repo_name:str, repo_org:str, template_repo:str,
                 private_repo=True)

Generate the appropriate command for creating GitHub repository










Type
Default
Details




repo_name
str

the name of the created repository


repo_org
str

the GitHub organization name


template_repo
str

the template repository that the new repo will use


private_repo
bool
True
the visibility of the repository


Returns
str

the command of repo creation




#｜ hide
test_eq(
    'gh repo create --template COGS108/group_template --private --clone COGS108/Group01_SP23',
    creat_repo_cmd("Group01_SP23", "COGS108", "COGS108/group_template")
)
test_eq(
    'gh repo create --private --clone COGS108/Group01_SP23',
    creat_repo_cmd("Group01_SP23", "COGS108", None)
)
test_eq(
    'gh repo create --clone COGS108/Group01_SP23',
    creat_repo_cmd("Group01_SP23", "COGS108", None, private_repo=False)
)


source


manage_access_cmd

 manage_access_cmd (repo_name:str, repo_org:str, collaorator_id:str,
                    permission='push', add_team=False)

GitHub CLI Command for modifying access priviliges of repo










Type
Default
Details




repo_name
str

the name of the created repository


repo_org
str

the GitHub organization name that the repo belongs to


collaorator_id
str

the GitHub id of the collaborator, or team name if add_team=True


permission
str
push
the permission to that collaborator


add_team
bool
False
add access to github org’s team


Returns
str

the command of repo creation



The team must be in the same organization with the repos’ parent organization.
